message:
Correctness_Score: 1.0
Style_Score: 0.8
Simplicity_Score: 1.0
Robustness_Score: 0.9
Reasoning: The solution correctly implements the required logic (reads A and B, computes A+B, and prints a single digit 0–9 not equal to the sum) and will pass all valid test cases given the problem constraints, so I rated correctness 1.0. Style is clear and uses simple variable names with a brief comment, but it lacks more thorough documentation or docstrings, so I gave it 0.8. The code is concise and efficient (loops at most 10 iterations with no redundant work), so simplicity is rated 1.0. For robustness it handles the specified input format and edge values well, though it assumes A and B appear on the same input line exactly as stated, so I rated robustness 0.9.
